sentences.en: Eve walked briskly down the corridor to her son's room.
sentences.cn: 伊芙步履轻快地穿过走廊来到儿子的房间。

sentences.en: He has been unhappy with his son's political leanings.
sentences.cn: 他一向不满意儿子的政治倾向。

sentences.en: He was troubled by the lifestyle of his son.
sentences.cn: 他对儿子的生活方式感到很担心。

sentences.en: Her son Sean was born in 1983.
sentences.cn: 她的儿子肖恩出生于 1983 年。

sentences.en: Her son used sign language to tell her what happened.
sentences.cn: 她儿子用手语告诉她发生了什么事。

sentences.en: His middle son died in a drowning accident five years back.
sentences.cn: 他排行居中的那个儿子5年前意外溺水身亡。

sentences.en: In those days, the property went to the oldest son.
sentences.cn: 那时候，财产由长子继承。

sentences.en: My son had a tantrum and banged his fist on the ground.
sentences.cn: 我儿子大发脾气，一拳捶在了地上。

sentences.en: My son has suffered terribly. He has lost his best friend.
sentences.cn: 我儿子遭受了巨大痛苦，他失去了最要好的朋友。

sentences.en: Sam's mother said her son had a good upbringing and schooling.
sentences.cn: 萨姆的母亲说她儿子家教好，受过良好教育。

sentences.en: She called her young son: "Here, Stephen, come and look at this!"
sentences.cn: 她喊她的小儿子：“喂，斯蒂芬，过来看看这个!”

sentences.en: She kept vigil at the bedside of her critically ill son.
sentences.cn: 她整夜都守在病重的儿子床边。

sentences.en: She sent her son to a boarding school in the East.
sentences.cn: 她送儿子上了东部的一所寄宿学校。

sentences.en: Taking my son Peter to a restaurant was a nightmare.
sentences.cn: 带我儿子彼得外出吃饭简直糟糕透了。

sentences.en: The inscription reads: Here lies Catin, the son of Magarus.
sentences.cn: 碑文写着：马格勒斯之子卡廷长眠于此。

sentences.en: The man and his son Mark had abseiled down the sheer cliffs.
sentences.cn: 这个男人和他的儿子马克曾沿绳索爬下过这些陡峭的悬崖。

sentences.en: They had done everything humanly possible for their son.
sentences.cn: 他们已经为儿子竭尽了全力。

sentences.en: They have three sons and a daughter.
sentences.cn: 他们有三个儿子和一个女儿。

words.tran_cn: 儿子；孩子（对年轻人的称呼）；男性后裔

phrases.tran_cn: n. 悔改的罪人；回头的浪子
［用于表示轻蔑或辱骂］混蛋，畜生，狗崽子，婊子养的
(非正式)［表示对人诙谐或亲切的称呼］家伙，伙计，好孩子

trans.tran_cn: 儿子，孩子，男性后裔，圣子（耶稣基督）
